Text.Value: You're in league with the damned drow?
You're siding with that monster against your own people?

EditorData.NodeContext: this is a horrible, terrible no-good realisation. He's taken aback by how bad things are right now. He's going to die

Text.Value: Traitor! You think you can stand against me and the Absolute?
Now slit his throat, and open that gate. The Absolute wants all of them dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: simple, to the point - killing is a very ordinary thing to her

Text.Value: I'll dissect you.
Obey and open the gate.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~With a gesture Minthara orders the attack.
EditorData.SFXTags: Goblins roar with the excitement of battle

Text.Value: Get that damn gate closed!

EditorData.NodeContext: urgent command

Text.Value: I'm truly sorry. I need healing - and the drow and her god are my best chance.

RuleGroup.RuleString: CLERIC_GOOD or CLERIC_NEUTRAL or PALADIN_GOOD or PALADIN_NEUTRAL

Text.Value: No. I'll show the Absolute the power of a true god.
My people? I'm loyal only to myself.
We have never been handed the easy choices, or the gentle paths. And this is no different.

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

Text.Value: I serve Shar, not the Absolute. The gate stays closed.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [LOGAN] Minthara Walk anim. Anims of creatues rushing forward to attack, including Spiders, Goblins. Bugbear commands the Goblins, with the Ogre at his side.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara steps up on the stone tower outside the gate to the Druid Grove, she assumes her imposing posture, arms at her back, she locks gaze with the player

Text.Value: Gods forgive me... I've doomed them all.
You will die here. And your god will die with you.
These people are under my protection - but I'll see you in the Hells.
Obviously.
Nothing personal? You betrayed us!

EditorData.NodeContext: furious; the players just betrayed him and are going to kill the people he swore to protect

Text.Value: You're mad. How did I not see it?

EditorData.NodeContext: He's realising that he just doomed his people by trusting us, but he blames himself. Quiet. Shocked.

Text.Value: You bastard.
Impspit!

EditorData.NodeContext: furious, shocked - 'impspit' delivered as a strong swear

Text.Value: It's nothing personal.
These creatures would take our lives, our children... our future. And we must resist!

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

Text.Value: I will not. Boo will not. And if you think to triumph here today, drow - you will not.
Sacred? It is filth. It will burn, and you will burn with it.
I know that you are all afraid... but I also know that you have been fighting your whole lives.

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

Text.Value: Of course - as does my god.
At least you'll die before the goblins find the children.
Not so fast. You've just walked into my trap.
Oh, hells.

EditorData.NodeContext: dawning horror - he's doomed and the players have betrayed him

Text.Value: Your god has no power here.
This place is sacred to Silvanus - the Absolute has no power here.
They still think I'm on their side. Poor fools.
Anyone who takes down a worg gets their choice of cut tonight...

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The player steps in an opens the gate [Reuse from Plea]

Text.Value: Traitor! The Blade now comes for you.
By Amaunator's Eternal Sun, none of us are dying today!

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

Text.Value: This is it. Everything turns on this.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous, gathering himself

EditorData.AnimationTags: [LOGAN] TIF_F Archer anim, Minthara Deflect anim.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~The archer nocks another arrow, when the army arrives beneath Minthara and lowers the bow to watch

Text.Value: This is it, people. Weapons ready, eyes to the front.

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

Text.Value: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind.*
New plan - I tear out your throat.
Oh gods...

EditorData.NodeContext: can't believe how awful we are - we just told him we're going to massacre the children he's been protecting

Text.Value: You'll burn in the Hells for this.
There's been a change of plan.
A pretty speech. It almost brings a tear to my eye.

EditorData.NodeContext: amused, referring to the tiefling leaders inspiring speech to the defenders but talking to the player

Text.Value: No. This grove is under my protection.
Die in fear, afore a waking nightmare.
Get that damn gate closed!

EditorData.NodeContext: urgent command

Text.Value: If I don't see you after the battle... tell the children I took out the drow.

EditorData.NodeContext: last phrase is delivered with a grim smile - if he doesn't see us, it's because he'll be dead

Text.Value: ...Hells. You're with them, aren't you?
...Hells. You're siding with them, against your own people?

EditorData.NodeContext: dawning realisation. We've betrayed him and he's going to die along with his people

Text.Value: You cower behind a doomed god when the Absolute promised you such power?
I will not bring death to this sacred place, Minthara.
Nothing personal? You betrayed us!

EditorData.NodeContext: despairing, the players have just betrayed him and doomed the people he swore to protect

Text.Value: What are you doing? They'll kill us all...

EditorData.NodeContext: shocked, genuinely doesn't understand what's happening - context: the player has opened gates allowing enemies to invade

Text.Value: You monster!

EditorData.NodeContext: furious, lots of venom on that 'monster'

Synopsis:
Takes place immediately after the player blows the horn at the gates of the grove, beginning an attack on the refugees hiding there. The surviving tiefling leader rallies his troops, then the drow commander arrives with her retinue of goblins. She mind-melds with the player. She expects them - as True Souls - to betray the tieflings, and players must choose whether to side with her OR with the tieflings as the attack begins.

This is a huge fight and a decisive moment for the tieflings, the drow/goblins, AND the players.
